other_tests.findings: The appendix is enlarged and edematous with wall thickening, measuring up to 1.1 cm in diameter. This is associated with extensive local fat stranding and small volume free fluid in the presacral space. No evidence of necrosis or perforation. Additional findings include a 1.3 cm hypodense lesion in the left lobe of the liver and a 1.4 cm nodule at the inferior aspect of the left adrenal gland.
